xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas
Class ListSA<E>

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.AbstractSweepArea<E>
      xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
          xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas.ListSA<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
SweepArea<E>, MemoryMonitorable, MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Coalesce.CoalesceSA, TemporalDifference.TemporalDifferenceSA, TemporalJoin.TemporalJoinListSA
public class ListSA<E>
extends ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>

A ListSA is a SweepArea that additionally links its elements with the help of a list. Each time an element is inserted into the underlying SweepAreaImplementor, it is appended to the internal list at the same time. The reorganization and expiration, respectively, is based on the linkage. The remove-predicate is applied to the first element of the list, and if it holds, this element is removed from the list as well as the underlying implementor. This step is performed as long as the remove-predicate holds.

See Also:
ImplementorBasedSweepArea, SweepAreaImplementor

Field Detail

list

protected List<E> list
The internal list providing an additional linkage of the SweepAreaImplementor's elements.

reorganizeMode

protected ListSA.ReorganizeModes reorganizeMode
The ListSA supports two different modes of reorganization. In the lazy mode, elements in the list are tested starting at the beginning. If one element can not be dropped, the reorganization stops. In the save memory mode the in each reorganization step the whole list is checked for elements which can be dropped. Note that there ist only a difference in the modes if ordering the elements by start- or end-timestamps gives different orders.

Constructor Detail

ListSA

public ListSA(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
              int ID,
              boolean selfReorganize,
              ListSA.ReorganizeModes reorganizeMode,
              Predicate<? super E>[] queryPredicates,
              Predicate<? super E>[] removePredicates,
              List<E> list,
              int objectSize)
Constructs a new ListSA.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.
ID - The ID of this ListSA.
selfReorganize - A flag to determine if this ListSA can reorganize itself.
reorganizeMode - The mode used for reorganization.
queryPredicates - An array of binary query-predicates used to probe this ListSA. Depending on the ID passed to the query-call, different query-predicates can be chosen for retrieval.
removePredicates - An array of binary remove-predicates utilized during the reorganization. With the help of this predicates, the elements of a SweepArea are probed for expiration. In analogy to the query-predicates, the predicate actually applied to this ListSA depends on the ID passed to the expiration and reorganization call, respectively.
list - The list maintaining the linkage of the implementor's elements.
objectSize - The object size of the elements in the sweeparea.

Constructs a new ListSA with a generally applicable query- and reorganization predicate.

Parameters:
impl - The underlying implementor.
ID - The ID of this ListSA.
selfReorganize - A flag to determine if this ListSA can reorganize itself.
queryPredicate - A generally applicable binary query-predicate used to probe this ListSA. Hence, this predicate is applied independently from the ID passed to query calls.
removePredicate - A generally applicable binary remove-predicates utilized during the reorganization. With the help of this predicates, the elements of a ListSA are probed for expiration. This predicate is applied independently from the ID passed to reorganization and expiration calls.
dim - The dimensionality of this ListSA, i.e., the number of possible inputs or in other words the number of different IDs that can be passed to method calls of this ListSA.
list - The list maintaining the linkage of the implementor's elements.
objectSize - The object size of the elements in the sweeparea.

ListSA

public ListSA(SweepAreaImplementor<E> impl,
              int ID,
              int dim,
              List<E> list)
Constructs a new ListSA with a generally applicable query- and reorganization predicate. This ListSA uses Equal.DEFAULT_INSTANCE for querying and new Not(Equal.DEFAULT_INSTANCE) for reorganization. A self-reorganization is permitted.

Parameters:

dim - The dimensionality of this ListSA, i.e., the number of possible inputs or in other words the number of different IDs that can be passed to method calls of this ListSA.

expire

public Iterator<E> expire(E currentStatus,
                          int ID)
                   throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                          IllegalStateException
Determines which elements in this ListSA expire with respect to the object currentStatus and an ID. The latter is commonly used to differ by which input this reorganization step is initiated.
If no elements qualify for removal, an empty cursor is returned and all elements are remained.
In order to remove the expired elements, either the returned iterator has to support and execute the remove operation for each expired element during traversal or the reorganize(Object, int) has to be overwritten to perform the final removal.

A cursor is returned that delivers the elements of this ListSA by traversing the linkage as long as removePredicates[ID].invoke(list.get(0), currentStatus) holds. Consuming element of this cursor implies that it is removed from the list as well as the implementor.

Specified by:
expire in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
expire in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to detect expired elements.
ID - An ID determining from which input this method is triggered.
Returns:
an iteration over the elements in this ListSA that expire with respect to the object currentStatus and an ID.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown, if this method is not supported by this ListSA.
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.

reorganize

public void reorganize(E currentStatus,
                       int ID)
                throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                       IllegalStateException
In contrast to the method expire(Object, int), this method removes all expired elements from a ListSA without returning them. The reorganization follows the internal linkage provided by a ListSA. In the lazy reorganization mode, as long as removePredicates[ID].invoke(list.get(0), currentStatus) holds impl.remove(list.remove(0)) is called. In the save memory reorganization mode, the whole list is checked for exprired elements

Specified by:
reorganize in interface SweepArea<E>
Overrides:
reorganize in class ImplementorBasedSweepArea<E>
Parameters:
currentStatus - The object containing the necessary information to perform the reorganization step.
ID - An ID determining from which input this reorganization step is triggered.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - An UnsupportedOperationException is thrown, if is method is not supported by this ListSA.
IllegalStateException - Throws an IllegalStateException if this method is called at an invalid state.
